page.title: 11Trade in Medbourne
page.content: Medbourne is a very self-sufficient village in terms of every day needs. It has a Post Office cum General Store, licenced to sell liquor; a butcher's shop with a small adjoining abattoir; two public houses, both privately owned and therefore Free Houses; a repair garage and filling station which also sells domestic bottled gas, sweets etc. and an antique shop whose main income stems from furniture, bronze and ivory renovation. In addition there are three hairdressers working from home; a fashion designer and manufacturer who employs local machinists; a gun dealer; a kit-aeroplane manufacturer;a window cleaner and two small building firms. There are also farmers, small-holders and three general haulage contractors.
